title: Sarah Whatmore (geographer)
summary: Dame Sarah Jane Whatmore DBE FBA FAcSS (born 25 September 1959[1]) is a British geographer. She is a professor of environment and public policy at Oxford University. She is a professorial fellow at Keble College, moving from Linacre College in 2012.[2] She was associate head (research) of the Social Sciences Division of the university from 2014 to 2016, and became pro-vice chancellor (education) of Oxford in January 2017. From 2018 she has been head of the Social Sciences Division.[3]
